headline: Ford donates $1 million and fleet of vehicles to Trump's inauguration
summary: Ford Motor Co is donating $1 million and a fleet of vehicles to U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's January inauguration, a company spokesperson said on Monday.  Policies on tariffs and electric vehicles that are being considered by the incoming administration would likely affect Detroit carmakers like Ford, who are struggling to ramp up and sell their battery-powered models.  Republican Trump has proposed significant tariffs on imports from Mexico and Canada, as well as killing an EV tax credit that benefits Ford.

headline: Government regulators close investigation into Ford Focus recalls
summary: Government safety regulators said Monday they have closed an investigation into two previous recalls of the Ford Focus after determining that Ford Motor Co. has satisfied its concerns.  In 2018, Ford recalled around 1.5 million Ford Focus sedans from the 2012-2018 model years because they could lose power.  The issue was a malfunctioning canister purge valve and software that didn’t adequately detect when it was stuck open.

The issue was a malfunctioning canister purge valve and software that didn’t adequately detect when it was stuck open.

headline: Auto Roundup: GNTX to Acquire VOXX, F Secures EV Battery Loan & More
summary: Gentex plans to acquire VOXX in an all-cash deal valued at $7.50 per share. Ford and SK On secure $9.6 billion EV battery loan.

headline: 1 Thing Ford Must Get Right for Investors in 2025
summary: As a longtime supporter and shareholder of Ford Motor Company (NYSE: F), I have heard my share of comments, both positive and negative, about the company.  In recent years, Ford has struggled to keep its costs down compared to crosstown rivals, and one big knock against the company's earnings per share has been its warranty costs, which reared its ugly head in recent quarters.  Ford unfortunately kicked off 2024 much the same way it operated throughout 2023, with a recall regarding its money-maker F-150 truck.
